channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KY

item.title: Report X-2024040802
item.description:
Report X-2024040802

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-22T15:11:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-14
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The hazmat was dropped causing the bottom of the drum to crack. We cleaned the spill with absorbent pads. We secured the hazmat and soiled clean up materials in a lined red tote. DescribePack: The bottom of the drum cracked DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: drum was placed upside down in a lined red tote.

item.title: Report X-2024040791
item.description:
Report X-2024040791

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-22T15:11:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-12
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was called to a spill, once admin arrived it was found that a plastic pail with hazmat diamonds on it was crushed under packages and leaking onto dock floor causing the spill. DescribePack: Side of plastic pail was cracked due to too much weight being on the plastic pail allowing a crack to develop and contents to leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Plastic pail was immediately put into a lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2024040759

Report X-2024040759

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-10
  • City: LEXINGTON
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered in its transport trailer with a large wet stain already on it. Package handlers were told to leave the truck and and package was properly relocated. DescribePack: 1 of the 4 gallon jugs inside did not have a fully screwed on top cap DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package was moved to a safe location

item.title: Report X-2024040721
item.description:
Report X-2024040721

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-09
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KENTUCKY, WE RESPONDED TO A DECLARED LEAKING DANGEROUS GOODS PACKAGE. THE PACKAGE HAS AN APPROPRIATE IATA SHIPPERS DECLARATION, CAO LABEL, CORROSIVE DIAMOND LABEL AND MARKING OF UN1903 DISINFECTANT, LIQUID, CORROSIVE, N.O.S. THE PACKAGE HAS SUCCESSFULLY PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT AT THE ORIGIN FACILITY IN INDIANA. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED (2) ONE GALLON CONTAINERS OF LYSOL I.C. QUATERNARY DISINFECTANT CLEANER. ONE BOTTLE WAS LEAKING FROM THE CLOSURE.

item.title: Report X-2024040544
item.description:
Report X-2024040544

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-18T18:14:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-04
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The cap on one of the bottles came loose and a leak resulted. Upon being found, the item was given to QA to be worked. DescribePack: Package was leaking from the bottom of the box. Upon being opened, it was found to have a leaking bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Contents were placed in a spill tote to prevent further leakage.

item.title: Report X-2024040485
item.description:
Report X-2024040485

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-02
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A package handler dropped the package while loading it causing the bottom to crack. We swept up the loose powder and secured the package and soiled clean up materials in a lined red tote. DescribePack: Bottom of the bucket cracked DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: We placed the hazmat in a lined red tote
